p: Differences between groups were analyzed by Mann-Whitney U test on compiled data from at least two independent experiments, unless otherwise noted in legends. Further, data from each independent experiment is shown as supplementary data in Figures S1– S10. Spearman's correlation was used to identify statistically significant associations between weight loss, influenza burden and lung neutrophils. P values above 0.1 are displayed as “ns” (not significant) in the figures, with values below 0.05 considered significant. All analyses were conducted using GraphPad Prism 7.
